text: hi everyone its elites from my cupcake
addiction today I'm going to be showing
you how to take some of your regular
candies and turn them into even cuter
candies to use to top your cakes and
cupcakes we're gonna be making candy
land theme cupcakes so let's get started
the things that you'll need for today's
tutorial I've got a cupcake of course
I've got a couple of lengths of ribbon
and I've got a marshmallow rope so it's
kind of like a twist of soft marshmallow
1 boiled lolly I've got a couple of
fruit shoes so this is kind of like a
chewy taffy I'm using pink and yellow
today you can also use fondant or
modeling chocolate here two mini Oreos a
piece of caramel fudge or a caramel chew
some chocolate chips and some little
round pink pearls they're just going to
be to go on top of our cake so you can
use any kind of a sprinkle you like
there I've got some scissors a toothpick
a skewer now this is not quite as long
as your regular skewers you can either
cut one down or you can buy them shorter
a knife some of our buttercream frosting
I'll link to our recipe in the
description box below and I've also got
just some sprinkles alright so we're
gonna start off just by making some of
our little decorations so we'll start
off with the easiest which is just going
to be this little car and we'll choose
so I just made these into basically mini
sized caramel choose just cut them in
half and then in half again so that
you've got kind of just these little
tiny cubes of caramel there just a bit
of an extra there's nothing really
technical to those ones I just thought
they added a little bit of something at
the back of my cupcakes so the back
wasn't looking too bad now I'm going to
use these chocolate chips to make kind
of like little mini whoopie pies or
little mini filled cookies so I'm just
gonna take some buttercream frosting in
my toothpick and just put a little bit
of frosting onto one of those chocolate
chips and then use the other chocolate
chip just to sandwich it together so
that it picks out the sides make a few
of those there at once again just a
really simple nice little space filler
and you can see I've used them there on
the front alright now for our little
candy we're gonna take some of that
taffy or some of your fondant depending
on what you're using in a similar color
so I've got a yellow boiled sweet I'm
just going to cut off two very similar
sized pieces of that taffy if you do you
think taffy or a fruit chew you can
microwave it for 5 or 10 seconds just to
make it a little bit softer and more
pliable and then you just want to sort
of flatten it out with your fingers and
take your scissors to cut in your little
kind of jagged edges like it's the edges
of a candy wrapper with that one you
want to make
sure that it is tapering in on a nice
little angle you can use your fingers
just to neaten it off and then you want
to take your boil to sweet and you just
want to wrap that sort of around to the
back so it's actually going right around
the back of the swing it gives you the
effect of being a traditional a little
wrapped lolly then we'll repeat that
with the other side
perfect there's your little wrapped
candy ready to go on top now to make
your cake really really simple we'll
take a little bit more of I'm going to
use a pink fruit to chew for this one or
pink taffy and you want to take those
two mini Oreos now with your mini Oreos
take the lid off one so just split them
pop that off to the side or eat it and
you want it just to fix that half to the
bottom half so what you're getting there
is kinda like a little tiered cake it
looks like three layers of cake and two
layers of frosting make sure that you've
got clean hands and note Oreo crumbs on
them and then you want to take that
taffy and I found about half was pretty
good here and just squeeze it out into
like a bit of a circle you want this to
be a little bit kind of rough or
textured on the edges because we want it
to go over the side like frosting so I
just took my finger and just sort of
went around and just made these little
indentations which kind of make it look
like when you look at a cake that
drooling frosting down the sides of the
cake then you want to take that piece of
taffy and you're just gonna lay it over
your Oreo and then you just want to take
it and just push that pretend frosting
down around the edges something like
that so you can take your little
sprinkles and these are gonna look like
little pretend cherries on our cake and
they should just stick directly to the
taffy if you decide to use fondant or
modeling chocolate rather than the taffy
or the preacher you need a little bit of
water just to stick these down perfect
there's a little tiered cake ready to go
finally we're going to make our little
marshmallow lollipops so these
marshmallow ropes come in all different
lengths and it's up to you depending on
what you can find where you are
I found that didn't quite need a whole
one I think I used about half for each
so snip it in half and then twist it
around you only want this to be a small
lollipop all right now taking the
pointed end of my skewer and piercing it
through roughly where this join has
happened so that you're getting is a
neater finish as you can support the
whole lot so that you're not squashing
it too far out of shape and poke that
skewer through the center there's your
little lollipop attach a little bit of
ribbon around the base of that skewer
just to give it a little bit more color
and a little bit more definition so now
that all of your decorations are done
it's as simple as frosting up a cupcake
and putting it
together so really really simple for
frosting I'm just gonna take some nice
big generous scoops of that vanilla
frosting you can use any flavor you like
here and I'm just scooping them on to
the top of the cupcake I'm gonna use the
back of my knife just to flatten them
down to make a bit of a a nice mound but
it doesn't have to be particularly neat
something a little bit like that
now take your cupcake and you want to
roll it into those sprinkles giving it a
really nice coating and then so that
you've got your really lovely cupcake
dome just use the palm of your hand just
to dome that off to stick your
decorations in you can start off with
your lollipop so just measure it out see
if you want to cut any off I might just
cut a little tiny bit off the bottom of
mine I like to put mine sort of just
towards the back and off on a little bit
of an angle don't you want to clear a
space for your little cake so just use
your toothpick and just expose a little
bit of that buttercream frosting under
those sprinkles that's really just so
that your cakes got something to stick
to and it's not just gonna fall off the
dry sprinkles push that right down into
the frosting
next comes your piece of candy over this
side once again just expose a little bit
of that frosting and straight down with
your piece of candy and I like to put
the little whoopie pies or biscuits at
the front here you want most of the
detail on these to be at the front but
like I said we've got those little
caramel so you can just expose a little
space at the back here and just pop in
some of those little caramel cheese just
so that your backs not to take it on our
cupcake and that completes your little
Candyland inspired cupcake I hope you
guys have loved this tutorial if you're
not already subscribed to my cupcake
